title: National Crime Victims' Rights Week, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump declaring April 6 through April 12, 2025, as National Crime Victims Rights Week. It emphasizes the need for safety in America, highlighting concerns over rising crime rates attributed to previous administrations' policies. The proclamation criticizes these policies for fostering an environment that emboldens criminals and endangers public safety. 

Trump asserts that his administration is committed to enhancing protections for law enforcement and proposes a new crime bill aimed at toughening responses to repeat offenders. He underscores the importance of community support for victims of crime and calls for collaboration among various organizations to protect their rights. The proclamation reaffirms the administration's pledge to create a safer nation for all citizens, regardless of their background.
